candidates.rationale: Ecosystem and services growth drive recurring cash flow.
Net-cash balance sheet, recurring revenue, and pricing power drive strong free cash flow; low capital intensity and disciplined capital returns fit a higher cost of capital environment.
candidates.theme: Higher-for-Longer Cost of Capital and Balance-Sheet Discipline: An elevated cost of capital versus the 2010s rewards companies with pricing power, free cash flow, and conservative leverage while pressuring long-duration and capital-intensive models; beneficiaries include insurers and brokers in hard markets, selective banks with stable deposits and fee income, cash-rich tech and industrials, and buyback or dividend growers, while overlevered CRE and rate-sensitive yield proxies remain challenged. (through May 2026)

candidates.theme: Consumer Barbell and Ad Spend Shift to Retail Media and CTV: Higher living costs and tighter credit drive trade-down at the low end while premium categories and experiences remain resilient, benefiting value retailers, club formats, off-price, and luxury; advertising dollars consolidate with platforms offering high ROI and closed-loop measurement, accelerating retail media networks, performance social, and connected TV, with positive spillovers to ad-tech and payments.
